title: Woman, Culture, and Society
text:
Woman, Culture, and Society, first published in 1974 (<a href="Stanford%20University%20Press">Stanford University Press</a>), is a book consisting of 16 papers contributed by female authors and an introduction by the editors <a href="Michelle%20Zimbalist%20Rosaldo">Michelle Zimbalist Rosaldo</a> and <a href="Louise%20Lamphere">Louise Lamphere</a>. On the heels of the 1960s <a href="feminist%20movement">feminist movement</a>, this book challenged <a href="anthropology">anthropology</a>'s status quo of viewing studied <a href="culture">culture</a>s from a male perspective while diminishing female perspectives, even considering women as comparatively imperceptible. It is considered to be a pioneering work.
